WHcircular 0.5.0
  • Reference

Circular-linear regression

Source: R/RcppExports.R
WH_reg_circlinear.Rd

Fits a circular-linear regression¹ model for outcomes in radians.

Usage

WH_reg_circlinear(y, X, tol = 1e-10)

Arguments

y

Numeric vector of radians.

X

Numeric matrix of predictors.

tol

Convergence tolerance. Default = 10⁻¹⁰.

Value

A WH_regfit list with elements:

  • coef: vector of estimated coefficients, ordered as κ, μ, β.

  • SE: vector of estimated standard errors, ordered as κ, μ, β.

  • p: p-values of the betas.

  • n: sample size.

  • loglik: maximized log-likelihood.

  • vcov: variance–covariance matrix of the betas.

References

  1. Fisher, N.I. and Lee, A.J., 1992. Regression models for an angular response. Biometrics, pp. 665–677.

Examples

y <- c("01:00","01:15","01:30","01:45","02:00",
       "23:00","23:15","23:30","23:45","00:00")
X <- c(rep(0, 5), rep(1, 5))
theta <- WH_HHMM_to_rad(y)
fit <- WH_reg_circlinear(theta, as.matrix(X))
print(fit$coef)
#> [1] 117.1153750   0.3926991  -0.2679492
print(fit$SE)
#> [1] 52.26269262  0.03086760  0.02219328
